articles.author: Kashmira Gander
articles.title: Coronavirus Recoveries Overtake New COVID-19 Cases in China for the First Time, Health Officials Say
articles.description: Professor Paul Digard of University of Edinburgh told Newsweek "this is excellent news."
articles.content:
The number of people who recovered from COVID-19 in China on Tuesday overtook those who fell ill for the first time since the outbreak of the new coronavirus, figures from the country's health department show.

articles.title: China's Expulsion of 3 Journalists Over WSJ Coronavirus Op-ed Condemned As 'Unprecedented Form of Retaliation'
articles.description: The Foreign Correspondents' Club of China called the journalists' expulsion the "most alarming" measure Chinese authorities have taken.
articles.content:
The Foreign Correspondents' Club of China condemned China's decision to expel three Wall Street Journal journalists over a new coronavirus op-ed published by the newspaper that the authoritarian country deemed racist.

articles.title: Coronavirus Update: Map Shows More Than 75,000 Confirmed Cases, More Than 2,000 Deaths
articles.description: The virus was first identified in humans in December when Chinese authorities reported 44 cases to the World Health Organization.
articles.content:

articles.author: Dan Cancian
articles.title: Will the 2020 Olympics Be Cancelled? Coronavirus Fears Mean Tokyo Games Couldn't Be Held Now, Says Scientist
articles.description: Over 2,000 people have been killed by the virus since the outbreak began in China at the end of last year.
articles.content:
The coronavirus outbreak has had such a great impact that if the Tokyo Olympics were scheduled for this month, they would not be allowed to go ahead.
